thread.title: US to jury: 2 British ex-bankers manipulated interest rates
thread.title_full: US to jury: 2 British ex-bankers manipulated interest rates - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: US to jury: 2 British ex-bankers manipulated interest rates
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - Two British former bankers are on trial in New York City federal court on charges they tried to manipulate interest rates, but their lawyers say they are not to blame.
Anthony Allen and Anthony Conti are the first to go on trial in the U.S. on criminal charges in the worldwide interest rate scandal.
Justice Department prosecutor Carol Sipperly told a jury Wednesday that the men used positions at one of the world's largest banks to rig LIBOR (LY'-bor), a measurement of London-based interest rates that affects interest rates worldwide.
Authorities say the manipulation of LIBOR occurred at their employer - Rabobank - from 2005 to 2011. The bank has paid a fine and cooperated.
Defense lawyers say ex-bank employees cooperating with prosecutors tried to make scapegoats of their clients.
